In reply to <a href="http://ast.io/html-emails-buddypress-bbpress/#comment-84">Lefteris</a>.
That's a good point. I've not tried this, but I wonder if removing the 'wp_mail_content_type' filter after step 3 might work. So, at line 26, something like: "remove_filter( 'wp_mail_content_type', 'set_html_content_type' );"
Let me know if you try this and have any success.
Alternatively, I notice in the examples, <a href="https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/hooks/wp_mail_content_type/" target="_blank" rel="noopener nofollow ugc">here</a>, there's a suggestion from stevenlinx to use an if statement to conditionally specify the content type.
